My respectable compatriot and friend  
Bag√©, April 12, 1843.

I had the pleasure of receiving your esteemed letter of the 7th of this month, in which, imploring me for the good of the Fatherland, you request my cooperation in the important mission that was entrusted to you; I deeply regret, citizen and friend, that my health troubles and a thousand other circumstances which I am not able to mention forbid me from engaging at present in any service.

Firm in my resolutions by certain principles, I have determined voluntarily to submit to my own nullity, and although I may not envy those who make sacrifices in favor of their country, nevertheless I happily know that my assistance cannot be of any use to you.

Nonetheless, the good of my Fatherland is such an object of dedication to me that as soon as I can, I will not hesitate to offer it all my care. Meanwhile, I cordially thank you for your remembrance as a proof of the high regard you have for me, with which I am also, with esteem and respect,

Your compatriot and friend, very grateful,  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Presidency of the Republic Secretariat  
Lieutenant Colonel Manuel Lucas de Oliveira,  
Commander of the 1st Brigade of the National Guard.  
Wherever you find him.  
From Lieutenant Colonel Alencastre.
